Reason: The 'enablePngCrush' configuration option is classified as performance-sensitive. This is because when the option is enabled, it directly affects the number of postprocessors added during the execution of the dconvert process. The code related to this configuration involves instantiating the PngCrushProcessor and adding it to the list of postprocessors if it is supported. This additional processing step can lead to notable performance variations at the system level, as it increases the processing time and resource usage of the system. Therefore, the configuration is considered performance-sensitive based on its impact on system performance and the related code operations.
